Description: Sleeveless garment (gallabiya, jellabia) woven of bue silk; rectangle with the ends folded over and sewn along top edge to make an open-fronted gown; holes cut near side tops for armholes; white triangles around neck edge.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Major-General Sir Cecil Edward Pereira
Acquisition notes: Af1902,1116.1 to 5 were given by Captain Pereira (later Sir Edward Cecil Pereira). All are garments from Africa, the first Egyptian, the rest Nigerian. The Nigerian material must have been collected in Nigeria, as Bida is recorded as the place of origin. He may have been in Egypt earlier, as he was in Kenya in 1898 and probably sailed there via the Suez Canal.
